alert.note: Alert for Eastern Albany; Schoharie; Western Albany; Western Greene (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 19 at 12:33PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT PARTS OF EASTERN ALBANY...WESTERN GREENE...SCHOHARIE...AND WESTERN ALBANY COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A snow squall which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 1233 PM EST, a snow squall was along a line extending from near Summit to Jefferson to near Hobart to near Colchester and moving east at 30 MPH. THIS SQUALL WILL BE NEAR... Jefferson around 1240 PM EST. Breakabeen around 1245 PM EST. Middleburgh and North Blenheim around 1250 PM EST. Gilboa around 1255 PM EST. Livingstonville around 100 PM EST. Prattsville and Preston-Potter Hollow around 105 PM EST. Windham and Preston Hollow around 110 PM EST. Westerlo around 120 PM EST. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&

area.areaDesc: Eastern Albany; Schoharie; Western Albany; Western Greene
